node.title: The Australian bushfire survivor taking on Scott Morrison at the Glasgow climate summit
node.alt: A woman stands in the bush, with a tree with bright red flowers behind her.
node.description: Jo Dodds knows what it is like to be on the climate change frontline, so she went to COP26 to pressure governments into doing more about the crisis.
node.content:
["Jo Dodds knows the horror of\u00a0Australia's\u00a0bushfires first hand.", "In March 2018, she evacuated her Tathra home on the south coast of\u00a0New South Wales with only the clothes on her back and watched from the bank of the\u00a0Bega River as the inferno rolled in.", "The wind changed and her house was spared, but many of her neighbours were not as lucky: 69 homes in\u00a0Tathra were destroyed.", "Now the bushfire survivor and Bega Valley councillor is at COP26 \u2014\u00a0the United Nations international climate summit in Glasgow \u2014\u00a0to pressure Prime Minister Scott Morrison to do\u00a0more to prevent what happened to her town.", "Ms Dodds is attending with\u00a0umbrella group Climate Action Network Australia (CANA), one of more than 2,000 non-governmental organisations attending the summit from around the world.", "She intends\u00a0to share her story \u2014 as well as those of other bushfire survivors\u00a0\u2014\u00a0at various events.", "\"Having the voices of people with lived experience of climate disaster is critical, because otherwise it just becomes that talkfest where it's all theoretical and hypothetical,\" she said.", "Ms Dodds's organisation, Bushfire Survivors for Climate Action, raised more than\u00a0$12,000 to fund her Glasgow trip.", "", "
Jo Dodds is the president of Bushfire Survivors for Climate Action and a Bega Valley councillor.\u00a0(Supplied: Tony Dean)
", "
What happens at the summit?\u00a0
", "COP26, which began on Sunday and will continue until\u00a0November 12,\u00a0is the most significant international climate summit since the\u00a0Paris Agreement was drafted in 2015.\u00a0", "World leaders, including\u00a0Mr Morrison, will discuss emission reduction targets and ways of supporting countries that are most vulnerable to climate change, such as low-lying Pacific nations.", "Mr Morrison announced\u00a0last week that Australia would commit to a target of net zero emissions by 2050.", "\"It will not shut down our coal or gas production or exports,\" he said.", "\"It will not impact households, businesses or the broader economy with new costs or taxes.\"", "However, the plan\u00a0was swiftly criticised\u00a0for not ramping-up the current\u00a02030 target \u2014 a key target being discussed at COP26 \u2014\u00a0and for relying on technologies that have not yet been invented.\u00a0", "Ms Dodds was unimpressed with the announcement, and aims to pressure Mr Morrison at COP26 to do more.\u00a0", "\"I'm really concerned that our Australian government is now announcing a target that's zero by 2050 without actually meaning it and without having a plan,\" she said.", "The government has said its approach is focused on \"technology\u00a0not taxes\"\u00a0and it is on track to beat its current 2030 target.", "An Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change report released in August found that keeping warming under 1.5 degrees Celsius was essential\u00a0to prevent catastrophic warming and natural disasters.\u00a0\u00a0", "Associate professor Ying Zhang, a senior epidemiologist and climate researcher at the University of Sydney, felt pessimistic about whether the world could\u00a0keep\u00a0warming below 1.5C.", "Australia's net zero target was a step in the right direction, she said, but\u00a0\"we need to see more commitment rather than lip service\".\u00a0", "\"We will definitely see more natural disasters because of climate change. We will see more people dying from the climate emergency\u00a0and the health risk is even bigger than the pandemic.\"", "", "
Dr Ying Zhang says\u00a0the world will experience increased weather-related disasters due to climate change.\u00a0(ABC News: Brendan Esposito)
", "Dr Zhang said lives could be saved if world leaders acted now by ramping-up their targets at COP26 and building resilient systems to deal with the risks posed by climate change.\u00a0", "\"We can reduce the health risks from bushfires, from extreme floods, we can save millions of people from losing their homes because of climate disasters,\" she said.", "
'I'm scared about the future of my kids'
", "Ms Dodds is not the only bushfire survivor\u00a0worried about future\u00a0natural disasters.", "On New Year's Eve, 2019,\u00a0Moosa Kutty had just stepped outside his Batemans Bay home to head to work when he realised something was off.\u00a0", "\"I\u00a0realised this is not how the sky looks usually around me \u2014 it's orange,\" he recalled.\u00a0", "His neighbour told him the council was instructing residents to evacuate, so Mr Kutty gathered his pregnant wife and young daughter and left town with only their important documents.\u00a0", "", "
Moosa Kutty had to evacuate his Batemans Bay home in the Black Summer bushfires of 2019\u201320.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "Mr Kutty's house survived, but he will never forget the experience of the fire.\u00a0", "\"I am worried about how things could end.\u00a0It was horrible living through\u00a0that,\" he said.", "He said he did not have enough information to say definitively\u00a0whether climate change was causing more frequent and severe\u00a0bushfires in Australia, but he said\u00a0more needed to be done to reduce emissions.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"We should strongly find ways to reduce burning of fossil fuels,\" he said.", "\"I'm scared about the future of\u00a0my kids.\"", "
Road to climate advocacy
", "", "
Jo Dodds was worried she would lose everything when she evacuated her Tathra home.(Supplied: Jo Yeldham)
", "After the Tathra fire, which nearly took out Ms Dodds's home, the prime minister at the time, Malcolm Turnbull, visited the Bega Valley.\u00a0", "He was asked about whether the fires were caused by climate change.", "\"We're the land of bushfires,\" Mr Turnbull\u00a0said.", "\"Nature hurls her worst at Australians, always will and always has, often unpredictably.\"", "Ms Dodds said she was shocked by his answer\u00a0and it was\u00a0what galvanised her to start her grassroots advocacy group.", "\"I know what you're saying: You're saying there's nothing to see here, that this is ordinary, that this is how fires have always been in Australia,\" she said.\u00a0", "Ms Dodds was terrified about bushfires becoming more frequent and more intense \u2014\u00a0a fear that was confirmed\u00a0when\u00a0the 2019\u20132020\u00a0Black Summer fires\u00a0hit the Bega Valley.\u00a0", "\"They did exactly what I feared.\u00a0There\u00a0was so much more damage, so many lives, so many homes, and so\u00a0many animals.\"", "", "
The\u00a0Bega Valley Shire was hit hard by\u00a0the Black Summer fires of 2019\u20132020.\u00a0(ABC News: Matt Roberts)
", "In August this year, the Bushfire Survivors for Climate Action\u00a0won a landmark court case which found that the New South Wales Environmental Protection Authority had\u00a0a duty to\u00a0\"develop environmental quality objectives, guidelines and policies to ensure environment protection from climate change\".", "While the court did not order specific regulation, the decision could pave the way for a cap on carbon.\u00a0\u00a0", "
Telling bushfire stories in Glasgow
", "Ms Dodds\u00a0said that, through her trip to Glasgow, she wants to put a human face on\u00a0the climate crisis to motivate world leaders into action.\u00a0", "", "
Jo\u00a0Dodds will be handing out postcards written by bushfire survivors at COP26.(Supplied: Bushfire Survivors for Climate Action\u00a0)
", "\"There are real people already being impacted,\u00a0already losing everything,\u00a0and there are more. There are\u00a0those same people and there are\u00a0more people in the firing line in the very near future.\""]
